Alphabet Writing Exercises Alphabet Numbers Quiz The syllables Learn to write Vocabulary Start "\n When a vowel is combined with a consonant, \n we get a syllable or “Sigande,” in Pular.\n Let’s start by learning how syllables \n are created. \n After that, complete the missing \n letters to create the syllables. \n Then trace the letters again \n to practice.\n " "The Adlam alphabet consists of 28 letters. \n" + "There are five vowels called Mase and \n" + "23 consonants called Yhiye. \n" + "They play the same role in English as \n" + "in Pular." THE SYLLABLES\nCOMPLETE and learn all adlam syllables \nCOMPLETE and learn all adlam syllables Wrinting Reading Consonant Previous Next Back Consonne: %1$s THE ALPHABET Trace and learn all adlam letters Lower Case Upper Case Setting Learn Alphabet Quiz Instructions You will hear a sound representing an Adlam letter. ADLaM Reading Rules:
1. ADLaM script is written from right to left. 2. The alphabet consists of 28 letters: 23 consonants and 5 vowels. 3. Primary syllable structures are CV and CVC. 4. Long vowels are indicated using diacritics. 5. Punctuation includes initial and final forms of question and exclamation marks. 6. Hyphens are used for word breaks; parentheses and double parentheses for grouping.
